alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hancock; Morgan; Putnam (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 8:39AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Morgan, eastern Putnam, northwestern Hancock and Greene Counties through 915 AM EDT... At 839 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms extended from Buckhead to Harmony to near Warfield, and moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Eatonton, Greensboro, Woodville, Buckhead, Phoenix, Reynolds at Lake Oconee, Liberty, Veazey, Harmony, Wrayswood, Oconee Springs Park, Greshamville, Rockville, Parks Mill, Carey, Swords and Penfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
